translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sal-flower Ancestors
“When the Lord of the World, the Blessed One,
the flowers I placed on the pyre,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the pyre.
How welcome it was for me,
I have done what the Awakened One taught.
I have done what the Awakened One taught.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā citakapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā citakapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Citakapūjaka recited these verses.
The Elder Citakapūjaka’s Birth Story, the second.
